edu.unl.abbot.vicar.Core

Class FileData

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.unl.abbot.vicar.Core.FileData

  • public class FileData
extends java.lang.Object
    Used by Vicar.java for Vicar Collection information. This information is retrieved from the unix directory structure (which is a mirror of the collection structure but not identical) and placed in a java.util.Vector. This vector is passed to the xml generation method of Vicar.java.
    Version:
    0.8, 12/15/2012
    Author:
    Frank Smutniak, Center for Digital Research in the Humanities, http://cdrh.unl.edu
    See Also:
    Server.Core.Vicar

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileData(java.lang.String the_OwnerID, java.lang.String the_Name, int the_InputCount, java.lang.String the_lastModified)
      Constructs a FileData object to store information about the user's collections.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileData

        public FileData(java.lang.String the_OwnerID,
        java.lang.String the_Name,
        int the_InputCount,
        java.lang.String the_lastModified)
        Constructs a FileData object to store information about the user's collections.
        Parameters:
        the_OwnerID - The ID of the signed in user.
        the_Name - The name of the collection. This is either NEW or a name selected by the user which is unique to the user account.
        the_InputCount - The number of input data files stored in the collection represented by tis FileData instance.
        the_lastModified - the text representation of the date for display under a tooltiptext on the website.

    • Method Detail

      • getOwnerID

        public java.lang.String getOwnerID()
        The ID for the user who created the collection.
        Returns:
        The ID of the owner of the collection.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        The vicar collection name given by the owner. This name is unique among all of the user's collections. The name starts as 'NEW' and the user is asked to give it a name.
        Returns:
        The name of collection's name.

      • getInputCount

        public int getInputCount()
        The number of input files uploaded by the owner or extracted from owner's uploaded gip, tar, or tar.gz file.
        Returns:
        The number of data files in the input subdirectory of this collection.

      • lastModified

        public java.lang.String lastModified()
        The text representation of the last modified date for the collection.
        Returns:
        The text of the date when this collection was last modified.
